dt: {bc}a contract by which one conveys real estate, equipment, or facilities for a specified term and for a specified rent

dt.t: took out a five-year {wi}lease{/wi} on the house

dt: {bc}the act of such conveyance or the term for which it is made
{bc}a piece of land or property that is {a_link|leased}

shortdef: a contract by which one conveys real estate, equipment, or facilities for a specified term and for a specified rent; also : the act of such conveyance or the term for which it is made
a piece of land or property that is leased
a continuance or opportunity for continuance

pt: {sc}hire{/sc} {sc}let{/sc} {sc}lease{/sc} {sc}rent{/sc} {sc}charter{/sc} mean to engage or grant for use at a price. {sc}hire{/sc} and {sc}let{/sc}, strictly speaking, are complementary terms, {sc}hire{/sc} implying the act of engaging or taking for use and {sc}let{/sc} the granting of use.

pt.t: we {it}hired{/it} a car for the summer
decided to {it}let{/it} the cottage to a young couple

pt: {sc}lease{/sc} strictly implies a letting under the terms of a contract but is often applied to hiring on a lease.

pt.t: the diplomat {it}leased{/it} an apartment for a year

pt: {sc}rent{/sc} stresses the payment of money for the full use of property and may imply either hiring or letting.

pt.t: instead of buying a house, they decided to {it}rent{/it}
will not {it}rent{/it} to families with children

pt: {sc}charter{/sc} applies to the hiring or letting of a vehicle usually for exclusive use.

pt.t: {it}charter{/it} a bus to go to the game

et: Anglo-French {it}lesser, laisser, lescher{/it} to leave, hand over, lease, from Latin {it}laxare{/it} to loosen, from {it}laxus{/it} slack {ma}{mat|slack|}{/ma}

dt: {bc}the transfer of goods and services to an ally to aid in a common cause with payment made by a return of the original items or their use in the cause or by a similar transfer of other goods and services

shortdef: the transfer of goods and services to an ally to aid in a common cause with payment made by a return of the original items or their use in the cause or by a similar transfer of other goods and services

meta.id: le coeur a ses raisons que la raison ne connait point:f
stems: le coeur a ses raisons que la raison ne connait point

hwi.hw: le cœur a ses rai*sons que la rai*son ne con*naît point

dt: {bc}the heart has its reasons, which reason knows nothing of

shortdef: the heart has its reasons, which reason knows nothing of
